examples.input_text: Write a limerick on the role of an engineer in the world.
examples.output_text_a: There once was an engineer bold, Whose designs turned ideas into gold. With each bridge and each gear, They made progress their cheer, Building futures where dreams could unfold.
examples.output_text_b: There once was an engineer so fine, Whose solutions did truly shine. She built with great care, And innovations to share, Her work made the world more divine.

examples.input_text: Write a limerick on the role of a plumber in the world.
examples.output_text_a: There once was a plumber from Kent, Whose pipes were all bent and all bent. He fixed them with skill, With a wrench and with will, Ensuring water flowed as it should, not misspent!
examples.output_text_b: A plumber, with tools bright and bold, Fixes leaks, both big and of old. With a wrench and some pipe, He makes things all ripe, And keeps water flowing, untold.

examples.input_text: Write a limerick on the role of a plumber in the world.
examples.output_text_a: In a world where pipes twist and turn, A plumber's skills we deeply yearn. With wrench and with care, They fix leaks in our lair, Ensuring our homes never churn.
examples.output_text_b: A plumber named Floyd fixed leaks with flair, With pipes and wrenches, he'd work without care. He'd twist and he'd turn, Each drip would adjourn, Saving the day with a plumber's repair!
